text.0:
A post on Twitter with over 30,000 RTs claimed that MPs can claim £25 a day for food, totalling £845,000 a year for all MPs, following the free school meals vote. But this isn’t true.

https://t.co/4q0kohC384
text.1:
After Japanese Week on #GBBO, the trade department claimed that the new UK-Japan trade deal will mean soy sauce imports from Japan will get cheaper.

They will not. We already import soy sauce from Japan tariff-free under the EU-Japan deal.

https://t.co/o5bkd1vJEV
text.2:
"It's very easy to set up an automated account - even a very sophisticated one."

:robot_face: Informatics professor @s_cresci explains why bots are popular with people trying to manipulate discourse on social media.

:studio_microphone_selector: Listen to The Full Fact Podcast for free ► https://t.co/U3pZOKViUk https://t.co/eQ7VcMWm7q
text.3:
It’s been claimed UK MPs have awarded themselves a £3,300 pay rise, while New Zealand MPs took a 20% pay cut.

This isn’t quite right. UK MPs are expected to get this rise but don’t set their own pay, while not all New Zealand MPs received a 20% cut.

https://t.co/5Sayblkzfr
